title: AdroSS could not initialize. Problem with su ?
body:
Hello,

My device is rooted and i have authorized the app, but despite that, i have the message on the title.

title: API Compatibility Issues
body:
Dear developers,

We have recently developed a state-of-the-art static analysis tool for uncovering API compatibility issues in Android apps. Applying this tool to open source apps on F-droid, we have exposed a few instances of compatibility issues and submitting them to development teams for a fix. 

For your app, we have found that this project has accessed the following APIs which are available only on an API level higher than the declared minSdkVersion and which are accessed without proper protection. In other words, if those APIs get called at runtime, it will trigger a NoSuchMethodError and thus result in a crash of the running application.

<android.util.Base64: byte[] decode(java.lang.String,int)>:[8,25]
<android.util.Base64: byte[] decode(byte[],int)>:[8,25]
<android.util.Base64: byte[] encode(byte[],int,int,int)>:[8,25]
<android.util.Base64: byte[] encode(byte[],int)>:[8,25]
<android.util.Base64: byte[] decode(byte[],int,int,int)>:[8,25]

Note that, because of the nature of the static analysis, we cannot confirm whether the flagged APIs would actually be called at runtime (e.g., unreachable code). However, we still believe that those APIs, which may cause compatibility issues, should not be accessed or at least be accessed with proper protections. 

In addition to the aforementioned APIs (i.e., backward-compatibility), which could cause app crashes if accessed, we have also identified that this project has also accessed some APIs that have been removed from the latest public SDK, making the app possibly suffer from forward-compatibility issues.

NONE

We would be very much appreciated if you can acknowledge to us that those reported APIs are indeed problematic for the projectâ€™s long-term stability. please let us know if you need any more information relating to this issue report.

title: Doesn't work
body:
I have samsung Galaxy TAB4 10.1 and cyanogenmod. I gave the program root permissions.
It doesn't do screenshots when I hold powerbutton and volume_down. Also I tryed to shake, but it doesn't work too.
When I hold powerbutton and volume_down or shake, there is nothing in logcat. Maybe my device doesn't react on such things.

Could you make a button in the program to take a screenshot after delay of some seconds?

title: su error on N900a Note 3
body:
I have a rooted Samsung N900A running Lollipop 5.0. Using SuperSU. Busy box installed. 

I get contradictory errors. When Enable is checked, a popup appears saying AndroSS failed to initialize, then followed, intermittently, by another popup indicating su access has been granted.

title: Shake mode could use a sensitivity control
body: I've got lots of junk screenshots I didn't intend to take.  I was using Screenshotit before and that has a slider for sensitivity. I imagine it's possible that not all hardware requires the same sensitivity.  More a feature request than a bug.

title: Enable all ABIs for NDK code
Pictures are "messed up" / not recognizable
body:
Hi everybody, does somebody encounter the same problem? Every picture I take with the app is "messed up". It looks like a box of water colors, spilled over the screen. I added two screenshots I tried to take. They actually should show an app screen and a home screen:

http://www.file-upload.net/download-7574923/2013-05-10_11.58.16.png.html
http://www.file-upload.net/download-7574933/2013-05-10_11.59.54.png.html

My configuration:
Device: HTC Wildfire (buzz)
OS: Android 2.3.7 (Cyanogenmod 7.2.0-buzz)
andOSS version: 0.4.3

Kind regards! Spectas

title: Enable screenshot by "long press on search button" or "notification area"
body:
Hello,

I do not have a hardware camera button on my HTC Desire HD, and I don't like shaking the phone.

Would it be possible to add the following feature please :
- Allow screenshot by long press on search button (I disabled Google Search so this button is useless for the moment) which would be the best method ?
- or also with an icon in top bar after enabling service and menu in notification area ?

Thanks !

title: AndroSS compatible with HTC Desire HD ?
body:
Hello,

I discovered yesterday AndroSS in the f-droid repositery and tried it, great opensource app.

Installation OK, I've a HTC DEsire HD rooted with custom ROM CyanogenMod 9 beta.

According Google Play, ANdroSS is not compatible with my phone, but a comment left on February told it worked on a DHD.

So I managed to get it from f-droid, but each time I try to make a screenshot by shaking after enabling the service, my phone crashes and restarts automatically.

If I can help with log or debug to find the problem, please ask me.

title: Tinted screenshots
body: Since this is a known issue and included in the description on Market Google Play (rolls eyes), I thought I'd create a tracking issue so people who run across this problem can let you know what they're running in a central spot. I'll start. I'm running the stock 2.2.2 firmware on a Motorola Triumph (MOTWX435KT), and my screenshots have been coming out tinted red. Very red, as in my green battery icon is magenta. It looks like there's little to no blue coming through, judging from the color of the Facebook app logo. You already know that AndroSS works great on the LG Optimus V (VM670).

title: Added Norwegian translation
body: hi, I'm not highly experienced with Git, but I have tried to add a values-no directory and a translated strings.xml in it. I have not changed anything else, but if you want to add this into the application, please do so.

title: Droid Bionic screenshots are botched
body:
Just rooted my Bionic.

No custom ROM.

http://i.imgur.com/H6hjM.png

title: Avoid capturing Superuser toast notification
body: Screen captures include the toast notification from Superuser indicating that AndroSS has been granted SU permissions. It should be possible to work around this with timing, at least, or ideally by excluding that component of the screen image.

title: Force close
body:
Hello,

I just installed AndroSS, and it crashes when taking a snapshot (with shaking the phone) with toast and vibrate notification. But it does not crash with toast only.

HTC Desire with CyanogenMod 7.0.0-RC2.

ProgVal
